He was dressed like a worker, was of average height, very young, slim, with short hair and thin features. The man he had pushed back followed him into the room and grabbed him by the shoulder; he was a guard, but Nikolay pulled away.

Many people crowded at the door, some trying to get inside. This all happened very quickly.

“Go away, it’s too soon! Wait until you are called! Why did you bring him so early?” Porfiry Petrovitch said, clearly annoyed and confused.

Suddenly, Nikolay knelt down.

“What’s wrong?” Porfiry asked, surprised.

“I am guilty! I am the murderer,” Nikolay said quickly, breathing hard but speaking loudly.

For ten seconds, there was silence as if everyone was shocked; even the guard stepped back and stood still.

“What is it?” Porfiry Petrovitch asked, coming out of his shock.

“I am the murderer,” Nikolay repeated after a short pause.

“What… who did you kill?” Porfiry Petrovitch was clearly confused.

Nikolay was silent for a moment.

“Alyona Ivanovna and her sister Lizaveta Ivanovna, I…”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Nikolay confesses to Porfiry Petrovitch that he is the murderer of Alyona Ivanovna and her sister Lizaveta.
